metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the ind-def:xmlfilecontent_test is properly supported.
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the ind-def:xmlfilecontent_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the xmlfilecontent_object with a path, filename, and xpath is supported.
Test that the xmlfilecontent_object with a path pattern match, filename, and xpath is supported.
Test that the xmlfilecontent_object with a path, filename pattern match, and xpath is supported.
Test that the xmlfilecontent_object with a path, filename not equals, and xpath is supported.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported with a limited depth of recursion.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported with a unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported.

xmlfilecontent_test.comment: Test that the xmlfilecontent_object with a path, filename, and xpath is supported.
Test that the xmlfilecontent_object with a path pattern match, filename, and xpath is supported.
Test that the xmlfilecontent_object with a path, filename pattern match, and xpath is supported.
Test that the xmlfilecontent_object with a path, filename not equals, and xpath is supported.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported with a limited depth of recursion.
Test that the max_depth behavior is supported with a unlimited depth of recursion.
Test that the recurse_direction behavior is supported.

xmlfilecontent_object.comment: This object represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path equal to '/tmp/support/xml/classes/class1', a filename equal to 'section1.xml', and an xpath query equal to '//*/grades/grade[@type='test']/text()'.

This object represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path that matches the regular expression '^/tmp/support/xml/classes/Class[0-9]$', a filename equal to 'section1.xml', and an xpath query equal to '//*/student[@status='full-time']/name/text()'.

This object represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path equal to '/tmp/support/xml/classes/class2', a filename that matches the regular expression 'section(1|2)\.xml', and an xpath query equal to 'count(//*/student)'.

This object represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path equal to '/tmp/support/xml/classes/class1', a filename equal to 'section1.xml', and an xpath query equal to '//*/grades/grade[@type='test']/text()'.

This object represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path equal to '/tmp/support/xml/classes', recursing down one level, a filename equal to 'section1.xml', and an xpath query equal to '//*/grades/grade[@type='test']/text()'.

This object represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path equal to '/tmp/support', recursing down infinitely, a filename equal to 'section1.xml', and an xpath query equal to '//*/student[@status='full-time']/name/text()'.

This object represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path equal to '/tmp/support/xml/classes/class2/subclass2', recursing up one level, a filename that matches the regular expression 'section(1|2)\.xml', and an xpath query equal to 'count(//*/student)'.

xmlfilecontent_state.comment: This state represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path equal to '/tmp/support/xml/classes/class1', a filename equal to 'section1.xml', an xpath query equal to '//*/grades/grade[@type='test']/text()', and a value_of that matches the regular expression '(83|87|93|86|100|76|53|97)'.

This state represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path that matches the regular expression '^/tmp/support/xml/classes/Class[0-9]$', a filename equal to 'section1.xml', an xpath query equal to '//*/student[@status='full-time']/name/text()', and value_of that matches the regular expression '(Bill|Kate)'.

This state represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path equal to '/tmp/support/xml/classes/class2', a filename that matches the regular expression 'section(1|2)\.xml', an xpath query equal to 'count(//*/student)', and a value_of equal to '4'.

This state represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path equal to '/tmp/support/xml/classes/class1', a filename equal to 'section1.xml', an xpath query equal to '//*/grades/grade[@type='test']/text()', and a value_of that matches the regular expression '(83|87|93|86|100|76|53|97)'.

This state represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path that matches the regular expression '^/tmp/support/xml/classes/class[0-9]$', a filename equal to 'section1.xml', an xpath query equal to '//*/grades/grade[@type='test']/text()', and a value_of that matches the regular expression '(83|87|93|86|100|76|53|97)'.

This state represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path that matches the regular expression '^/tmp/support/xml/classes/class[0-9]$', a filename equal to 'section1.xml', an xpath query equal to '//*/student[@status='full-time']/name/text()', and a value_of that matches the regular expression '(Bill|Kate)'.

This object represents a xmlfilecontent_item with a path equal to '/tmp/support/xml/classes/class2', a filename that matches the regular expression 'section(1|2)\.xml', an xpath query equal to 'count(//*/student)', and a value_of equal to '4'.
